thread.title: DC plane crash delays, cancels flights in NY: What to know
thread.title_full: DC plane crash delays, cancels flights in NY: What to know

author: , The Journal News
title: DC plane crash delays, cancels flights in NY: What to know
text:
Flights from NY airports to D.C. canceled, others delayed: What to know , New York Connect Team Show Caption
Hide Caption
Figure skaters aboard American Airlines flight that crashed in DC Russian skaters and coaches Yevgenia Shishkova and Vadim Naumov were aboard the crashed flight returning from Kansas. Flights to Washington D.C. from New York City-area airports are being cancelled Thursday after a military Black Hawk helicopter and a plane carrying 60 passengers and four crew members collided near Reagan National Airport on Wednesday night.
The crash occurred just before 9 p.m. Wednesday when American Airlines Flight 5342 from Wichita, Kansas, attempted to land and collided in midair with the Blackhawk helicopter, which was carrying three people, USA TODAY reported .
Twenty-seven people were recovered from the plane and one body was recovered from the helicopter. Officials believe there are no survivors as John Donnelly, the chief of Washington’s fire department, said at a news conference Thursday morning that authorities were switching from a “search-and-rescue operation to a recovery operation.”
Here's what to know.
NYC-area airports cancel flights to Washington D.C. after plane crash According to the Federal Aviation Administration , Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport has been closed as of 9 p.m. Wednesday and is expected to reopen at 11 a.m. on Thursday.
As of 8:30 a.m., more than a dozen flights to Washington D.C. from New York City's three major airports — John F. Kennedy International, LaGuardia and Newark Liberty International — have been canceled.
According to the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey's flight tracker , there are nine cancellations between 8 and 8:55 a.m. for nine different airlines at JFK. Flights departing at 9:59 a.m. or later are listed as on schedule.
LaGuardia has two cancellations between 8:04 and 8:29 a.m. for American and Delta airlines, according to the flight tracker , and flights departing at 10:27 or later are listed as on schedule.
Newark has four cancellations at 8:18 a.m. for four different airlines, the flight tracker shows .
Live updates: Officials believe there are no survivors in plane crash near DC
Upstate NY airports also experiencing cancellations Six flights between 5:13 a.m. and 5:27 p.m. heading to Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport from the Frederick Douglass Greater Rochester International Airport Thursday have been cancelled.
Syracuse Hancock International Airport and Buffalo Niagara International Airport also list six cancellations each to the Washington D.C.-area airport Thursday.
Five cancellations are listed for flights departing from Westchester County Airport and heading to Ronald Reagan Washington National Airport between 6:30 a.m. and 5:09 p.m. Thursday.
Who was on board the plane? Among those on board the flight were a group of figure skaters, their coaches and family members returning home from the U.S. Figure Skating Championships in Wichita, according to a statement from U.S. Figure Skating, the sport's American governing body.
Russian figure skaters and other Russian nationals were on board the plane that crashed in Washington, Kremlin Spokesman Dmitry Peskov said in a briefing on Thursday. Russia's state news agency TASS reported that Russian figure skaters Evgenia and Vadim Naumov were on board the crashed plane.
Emily Barnes reports on consumer-related issues for the USA TODAY Network’s New York Connect Team, focusing on scam and recall-related topics. Follow her on Twitter and Instagram @byemilybarnes . Get in touch at ebarnes@gannett.com .
